page.title: 08Meldrum and Bourtie Property
page.content: The communities of Meldrum and Bourtie have traditionally been linked. They still have right of ownership of certain land on the edge of the town of Oldmeldrum. Gordon District now administers the 25 acre Pleasure Park east of the town, given by an ancestor of the present Laird of Meldrum to the townspeople. Today that land is roughly split in three, one third enclosing the Pleasure Park with its soccer and rugby football pitches, tennis courts, bowling green and children's playground; one third forms the Golf Course on which stands the erratic boulder, the Groaning Stone; and one third the Feuars' Moss, where residents still have peat rights although peat for fuel is no longer dug. Coal fires heat most homes alongside gas/oil central heating.
